subtitle: Masala is a basic of Indian cookery and especially popular in South India.

method.text: Cut the fillets into 4 x 10 cm square pieces. Place in a shallow dish. Pour over the vinegar. Leave to stand for 30 min.

Meanwhile, place the ginger, garlic, lemon juice, chilli and coriander in a food processor or blender and process until smooth. Pour off the vinegar from the fish into the blender. Process until smooth.
Pour over the fish and leave to marinate for 3-1 days in the fridge.
Remove the fish from the marinade, scraping off any excess marinade. Stir in the chickpea flour and a little water if necessary to make a smooth batter.
Heat the oil in a saucepan to 180?C. Dip the fish in the batter until well coated.

Cook the fish, two pieces at a time, for 3-5 min or until crisp and golden. Remove from oil with a slotted spoon. Drain thoroughly on kitchen paper. Repeat with remaining fish, keeping those already cooked warm while cooking the remainder. Serve immediately.

title: Masala fried cod
